page.title: 15Birket Houses
page.content: Birket Houses built in 1908, is an example of a new trend in holidays. To live in lovely rooms and to be surrounded by gardens of 20 acres where there are still red squirrels, deer and where hens lay free renge eggs, goats and the family cows supply the dairy food, is to enjoy life in the country which was fast dissappearing. In complete and satisfactory contrast to the new cell like modern motels with their bare walls, modern furniture, "colour TV and mod cons", here there is oak panelling, even a four poster bed in some bedrooms, wide and comfortable window seats, with superb views even in the winter, and yet warm central heating, plenty of hot water, subtle electric lighting.
